dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so like, almost four thousand doctors? Just... gone?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is experiencing a shortage of doctors, according to the Ministry of Health. The country needs nearly 4,000 specialists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, not exactly gone, A. It's a shortage, a need for that many specialists, uh, specifically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not exactly gone, A. It's a shortage, a need for that many specialists, uh, specifically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is experiencing a shortage of doctors, according to the Ministry of Health. The country needs nearly 4,000 specialists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh. Okay, a need. So like, what kind of doctors are they missing, then? Is it like, GPs or...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh. Okay, a need. So like, what kind of doctors are they missing, then? Is it like, GPs or...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, GPs are definitely on the list, actually. But, uh, therapists are number one, like, over 360 full-time spots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, GPs are definitely on the list, actually. But, uh, therapists are number one, like, over three hundred sixty full-time spots.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The highest shortage of medical personnel is recorded among the following specialists: Therapists " 364.25 full-time positions; General practitioners (GPs) " 290.5 full-time positions;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Therapists? Huh. I would've thought like, surgeons, you know, for emergencies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Therapists? Huh. I would've thought like, surgeons, you know, for emergencies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Surgeons too, for sure, about 210 spots. And, um, obstetricians-gynecologists, anesthesiologists, pediatricians, even lab doctors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Surgeons too, for sure, about two hundred ten spots. And, um, obstetricians-gynecologists, anesthesiologists, pediatricians, even lab doctors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Obstetricians-gynecologists " 253.25 full-time positions; Anesthesiologists-resuscitators " 225 full-time positions; Surgeons " 210.5 full-time positions; Laboratory doctors " 189.5 full-time positions; Pediatricians " 184.25 full-time positions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so pretty much everything. But, wait, I thought I read somewhere doctors were leaving Kazakhstan? Is that still happening?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, so pretty much everything. But, wait, I thought I read somewhere doctors were leaving Kazakhstan? Is that still happening?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a good question. The Ministry of Health actually says the outflow has decreased significantly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a good question. The Ministry of Health actually says the outflow has decreased significantly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the Ministry of Healthcare reports a decrease in the outflow of medical personnel abroad.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Really? Like, by how much? I mean, um, what's significant?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Really? Like, by how much? I mean, um, what's significant?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: From 760 in 2020, it dropped to just 280 last year. A big difference, right? And mostly to, like, other CIS countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: From seven hundred sixty in twenty twenty, it dropped to just two hundred eighty last year. A big difference, right? And mostly to, like, other C I S countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While 760 doctors left Kazakhstan in 2020, the number significantly dropped in 2024 to just 280 specialists. The majority (80%) relocated to CIS countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay. So, fewer people leaving. But are more people, like, coming in then? To help with the shortage?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay. So, fewer people leaving. But are more people, like, coming in then? To help with the shortage?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! That's the other side of it. Foreign doctors are actually increasing their numbers coming into Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! That's the other side of it. Foreign doctors are actually increasing their numbers coming into Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, the number of foreign doctors coming to work in Kazakhstan is growing:

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For real? Like, how many? Is it a lot?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For real? Like, how many? Is it a lot?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's growing. Uh, from 374 in 2022 to 608 in 2023. And almost as many last year, 575.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's growing. Uh, from three hundred seventy four in twenty twenty two to six hundred eight in twenty twenty three. And almost as many last year, five hundred seventy five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2022 " 374 people (324 from CIS countries); 2023 " 608 people (525 from CIS countries); 2024 " 575 people (498 from CIS countries).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, uh, they're mostly from where, then? Are they, like, from everywhere?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, uh, they're mostly from where, then? Are they, like, from everywhere?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mostly from CIS countries again. Like, about 500 of them in 2023 and 2024 were from the CIS region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mostly from C I S countries again. Like, about five hundred of them in twenty twenty three and twenty twenty four were from the C I S region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2023 " 608 people (525 from CIS countries); 2024 " 575 people (498 from CIS countries).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Okay. So, uh, a shortage, but the brain drain is slowing down, and new people are coming in. That's... positive, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Okay. So, uh, a shortage, but the brain drain is slowing down, and new people are coming in. That's... positive, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it suggests some balancing, you know? Especially in places like Almaty and Shymkent, which are seeing a lot of the new arrivals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it suggests some balancing, you know? Especially in places like Almaty and Shymkent, which are seeing a lot of the new arrivals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The highest percentage of incoming medical professionals is observed in Almaty, Shymkent, as well as in the Almaty, Atyrau, and Aktobe regions, the Ministry of Healthcare added.
